Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with jackal-headed Hermanubis holding a caduceus and palm-branch. Between the nozzle-volutes is an air-slit. The lamp stands on a slightly raised base. The underside was dinted before firing. Covered with a worn brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q801.bis)
